issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
HEAD request for specific version of object fails with 500 error due to backend getting the wrong request. The S3Provider is setting the versionId unnecessarily since we don't use versioning on the backend.

WalrusProvider should override the headObject method as well, to use the internal message instead of the S3 client version. Failure seen with both Walrus and RiakCS backends.
fields.summary: HEAD of object with VersionID fails with 500 error

comments.body:
Internal Commit: d2db6011fa4d01adad9f2b9d5c9bf10fc52b299b
Eucalyptus Commit: 10dbb29bebe2559e9fae1fed9ed8ad773621d4d0

To test:
Create bucket
Enable versioning on that bucket
Put object, save versionId1
Put object, save versionId2
Head object with versionId=versionId1

Confirm 200 OK response and proper Etag

Fixed.

*Installed Packages*
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.785.20140331git2e6ac661.el6
Size        : 275 k
Repo        : installed
{noformat}


{noformat}
